column3: Mini personal history
Character guidelines for chatter
column4:
Detritus
A civilian on Detritus who was caught on the sidelines of the earliest Vek attacks, Kate Shreeve was left orphaned, injured, and deafened. As she recovered, she fine-tuned one of her late parents' inventions in order to hear again, and found that the receiver could detect the rumblings of underground Vek movement. Unable to sit by while the sounds of doom approached, she volunteered as a Mech Pilot despite her young age, and impressed her instructors with the unconventional acrobatics she employed in combat.
column5:
Pinnacle
A former operative for Pinnacle's clandestine Ministry of Strategic Science, Roland White worked alongside human and artificial agents to catalog and deal with strange phenomena across all of the islands and the ocean between. In his original timeline, the Ministry were the first to discover the Vek, and most of its agents were among the first casualties. As the survivors began fighting back with Mechs, they developed the reactive Titan Armor technology to limit further losses, a breakthrough which White carries with him to other timelines.
column6:
Detritus
Discovered in the Vek tunnels beneath Detritus, no one is sure what exactly Athena is; some strange turtle mutated by the island's runoff? A crashed-landed alien? A bioengineered warrior from another timeline? Athena herself has no memory of how she came to the island, but she is adept with machines and eager to drive off the Vek, despite a clumsiness that sometimes causes unwanted collateral damage. The overseers of the Pilot program quickly decided that she might as well be bumping into Vek, and turned her loose on the battlefield.
column7:
Pinnacle
Amelia Espada was a wandering soldier, touring the corporate islands in the calm before the Vek invasion. She became one of the first Mech pilots and enthusiastically sought out every combat mission she could. As the Vek gained ground and many of her fellow Pilots were lost, she realized that she needed whatever edge she could get, and began volunteering to test whatever new Mech capabilities the scientists could conceive. One successful prototype quickly became her favorite: a self-repairing liquid metal shell that kept her Mech in the fight long after it should have fallen to pieces, allowing her to fight more furiously than ever.
column8:
RST
A retired aviator with a long and distinguished career spanning multiple organizations on R.S.T. and Archive, Esther Martin was something of a legend throughout the corporate archipelago. When the Vek attacked, Martin was pulled in to the nascent Mech program and became one of the senior combat instructors, training the ragtag assortment of volunteer Pilots. No one was surprised when she insisted on leading them into battle as well, where her experience has been invaluable in keeping her squad alive.
column9:
RST
The extreme conditions on R.S.T. meant their medical response personnel needed to be hardy, effective, and determined, and Mark Savage was the best of their best. Before the Vek arrived he had already earned the callsign "Doc Havoc" for treating injuries in the violent and chaotic highland storms. The moniker held even more true as he transitioned to piloting a Mech and caring for his squadmates on hellish island battlefields. Though less gifted with repairing metal than flesh, Savage's iron composure, steady hand, and drive to protect have made him the heart and soul of his squad.
column10:
RST
An R.S.T. geological scout used to getting in and out of difficult terrain, Janet Walker spent the early portion of the Vek invasion operating Search and Rescue vehicles to save civilians. After seeing one too many scenes of destruction, she transferred into the Pilot program in the hopes of preventing such disasters, rather than dealing with their aftermath. Never happy standing still, Walker also acquired and experimented with a miniaturized Breach generator, altering it to create spatial breaches that would allow her to quickly teleport wherever she needed to be in moments of crisis.
column11:
Archive
Alain Mormont was an eager student of Old Earth history, especially the honor-bound warrior knights of the medieval era. Exploring and embracing their philosophies as she pored over old relics, the Vek invasion gave her the chance to prove that she could follow the same path and protect the helpless. She was accepted into the Pilot program, but a training exercise involving an uncontrolled temporal Breach left her inexplicably desynchronized from the timeline. Almost a year later, in a burst of light, she managed to regain temporal cohesion in front of a surprised group of maintenance engineers. Now she is learning to control her temporal drifting in order to quickly shift her Mech around the battlefield.
column12:
Archive
A distant relative of Detritus' CEO, Jai Chandra spent much of his life trying to distance himself from his family's privilege and prove himself on his own terms. He followed his father into physics, focusing on gravity-controlling devices with the potential to reshape the islands, possibly the world. The Vek invasion led the Chandras to alter their technology into Mech-mounted weapons, and Jai joined the Pilot program to see them used in defending their home.
column13:
Archive
While most Time Pods arrived from the sky, the one bearing Sen was unearthed deep in the forests of Archive. The mysterious being inside the Pod woke soon after it was opened, friendly and curious to learn the state of the world. Corporate scientists were at a loss to explain her appearance, or her seeming ability to alter the atmosphere and weather patterns around her, but they quickly noted her hatred of the destructive Vek, and passed her on to the Pilot program.
column14:
Detritus
A masked soldier known only by his call sign, Gargoyle has shared little of his past. Whispers spread among his fellow pilots that he had accidentally destroyed his original timeline while piloting a dangerous new superweapon derived from the Vek. Gargoyle's advanced biosuit has proven capable of interfacing with Mech systems, allowing him to siphon bioelectric energy from nearby targets directly into his Mech's reactor.
column15:
Pinnacle
Put into cryo-stasis long ago after an industrial accident, Ryan Frost was rudely reanimated when the Vek invasion disrupted power to the forgotten stasis facility. As a result, he now requires a special thermal suit to survive, which has done nothing to improve his view of his new situation. Lacking any other way to acquire such technology, he grudgingly volunteered as a Mech Pilot, and had his personal Mech retrofitted with specialized heat exchangers to ensure he stays cold and alive.
column16:
Unknown
A shrouded, nomadic being, the Stranger survived well past the fall of civilization in his original timeline. He stalked the post-apocalyptic jungles of his home island for years in salvaged Mechs, as the radioactive wasteland slowly changed him into something else. He eventually found and repaired a Time Pod, escaping the end of the world. Though he can no longer even remember his original form or name, his knowledge of the Vek is second to none.
column17:
Archive 
Dr. Andromeda McLear was an astronomer with Archive's Space Command, investigating deep space through observation satellites. The inexplicable Vek invasion confounded her ordered view of the world, and she transitioned to the Pilot program in large part to research them and whatever phenomena were responsible for their appearance. On the battlefield, she feeds enemy coordinates to her old colleagues so that the few remaining orbital defense satellites can be targeted at the Vek swarms.
column18:
Archive
A professional gambler from Archive, Earl Deckard made a living playing the odds. Though his integrity was somewhat in question, he was quick to spot and exploit any vulnerability his opponent showed him, a skill which the Pilot program found valuable. The former card sharp now focuses on winning the ultimate game: outwitting the Vek on the battlefield, using every cheap trick and unfair advantage he can find.
column19:
Archive
While Breach technology has provided hope against the Vek, the Corporations' understanding of it is still limited. As such, none of their scientists have been able to explain how an Old Earth warrior from the distant past stepped out of a Time Pod recovered from Archive. Declaring himself Sir George of Mormoth, he exhibited a surprising acceptance of the situation around him. The knight's discipline and tactical cunning made him a fast learner and, soon enough, a capable pilot for the giant suits of armor called Mechs. Now he wades into combat with the hope of saving this future and finding a path home.
column20:
Detritus
Simon Coil was fascinated by death. In particular, the sentient machines of Pinnacle, with their potential to be revived after physical destruction, seemed to Coil like the ultimate goal of humanity. The corporate intelligence agencies were vaguely aware of his attempts to reanimate and control deceased organics through advanced neurochemical stimulators; the arrival of the Vek led Coil to openly approach them and volunteer his experimental techniques for use on the Vek.
column21:
RST
Julia Takahashi spent her early life as a Corporate solider. When her term of service was up, she continued to utilize and develop her combat skills as a mercenary sharpshooter, joining a shadowy intra-island coalition. The pay was excellent, but the job soon began taking its toll on her conscience. The appearance of the Vek allowed Takahashi to apply her unerring aim to a less ambiguous set of targets, and she has been known to carry her personal sniper rifle with her into combat, making impossible shots from her Mech's cockpit.
column22:
Detritus
Office Tang was part of Detritus' corporate dispute department, which served as a pseudo-police force in charge of maintaining order across the island. Her harsh sense of justice was balanced by an equally fierce loyalty to her friends, and she was rising quickly through the ranks when the Vek invasion almost cost her an eye. Now scarred and out for vengeance, she wades into combat to exact retribution for humanity.
column23:
Detritus
Ezekiel Gray became the head of Detritus' Energy Division at a young age, recklessly pursuing experimental reactor technology to expand the Grid. A catastrophic meltdown left him irradiated and slowly dying; his attempts to find a cure for his condition resulted in unintended casualties and a prison sentence. However, his ruthlessness and skill have earned him a pardon in order to help defeat the Vek, and the core shielding found in Mechs actually slows his cellular decay. While he has little hope of surviving the war, Gray sees Breach technology as a chance to find other timelines where a cure might exist.
column24:
Pinnacle
A stage magician and gifted sleight-of-hand artist, Marika Prochazka came to the attention of the War Council after miraculously surviving a Vek attack on the venue she we was performing at. Deciding that her career as an entertainer was of little consequence if the Vek won, she applied herself to Mech training and soon earned a reputation for her almost supernatural ability to avoid certain death. When the smoke cleared, 'The Magnificent Mara' was always still standing, ready to continue the fight.
column25:
Pinnacle
A former Detritus scientist, Karl Schraeder relocated to Pinnacle in his pursuit of human-machine hybridization. He applied his extensive knowledge of A.C.I.D. to the creation of versatile, programmable nanites, which could integrate with and repair flesh and metal alike. After suffering grievous wounds during a Vek attack, Schraeder saw the nanites as his only chance to recover and rejoin the war effort, becoming the islands' first cyborg in the process. While there have been unexpected side-effects, he hopes to apply the technology towards rebuilding the islands, once the war is over.
column26:
RST
R.S.T.'s constantly-shifting geography made mapping the island difficult, until Alec Shaheen single-handedly founded the Corporate Cartography Society to gain a detailed understanding of the island, including the tunnels beneath it. Soon he was contracting with the other corporations as well, and the invasion brought new work in plotting Vek movements and locating their burrows. Eventually the work became too dangerous to do without a Mech; now Shaheen uses holographic mapping tech to create decoys as he surveys the battlefield terrain.
column28:
Pinnacle
Amelia Espada was a wandering soldier, touring the corporate islands in the calm before the Vek invasion. She became one of the first Mech pilots and enthusiastically sought out every combat mission she could. As the Vek gained ground and many of her fellow Pilots were lost, she realized that she needed whatever edge she could get, and began volunteering to test new Mech capabilities conceived by the scientist teams. One successful prototype quickly became her favorite: an emergency power regulator which amplified combat abilities in dire situations, allowing her to fight more furiously than ever.

column3: This happens at the start of a new game
column4:
"I can still hear screaming when I close my eyes... let's make sure this timeline ends differently.",
"Sounds like you've assembled a great squad. I hope I can contribute.",
column5:
"Well, I've seen stranger things as part of the Ministry. Let's do this.",
"How'd I get here, again? Damn timelines are hard to keep track of.",
column6:
"The ocean, it's... so distracting.",
"Focus... focus... new timeline... time to squash some monsters?",
column7:
"I'm ready.",
"Time to save the world. This one, at least.",
"If we fail here, we can always try again in another timeline.",
column8:
"There's been enough suffering in this timeline; let's do something about it.",
"We may have ruined the place, but it's still our planet. I'm not letting the Vek take what's left.",
"If we can drive the Vek from even one of the islands, its infrastructure can start recovering and help support our campaign.",
column9:
"Let's get right down to it. We have to eliminate the Vek or everyone on these islands is done for.",
"#self_second, reporting for duty. Honored to be helping save this timeline.",
"We'll save as many as we can along the way. Who knows, this may be the timeline where we win, and everything sticks...",
column10:
"Sorry, I'm always a bit scattered after the big jumps. Did I make it to the right point in this timeline? You're at war with the Vek, right?",
"Hi, I'm #self_full. I'm, well, I'm here from the future. To help save everyone.",
"I hate those big jumps... #self_second, Mech pilot, here to help save the world. Where do we start?",
column11:
"What have you got for us? We're ready!",
"You know Old Earth knights wore metal suits into combat? Piloting Mechs isn't so different!",
"The Vek have destroyed so much. No time to lose; the #squad are ready for our first mission!",
column12:
"Tell me what you need, I'll see it gets done.",
"These Mechs aren't quite as... glamorous as they looked from afar. But I've seen them in action. I know how effective they are.",
"Ready to assist the #squad however I can.",
column13:
"What a strange world to wake up in!",
"The world looks very different from when I last saw it.",
"There are too many monsters in this world. We must restore balance.",
column14:
"There's little enough left of civilization. We can't let the Vek destroy what remains.",
"Everything has a weakness; we must find it for the Vek and turn it into our strength.",
"The #squad are ready, commander.",
column15:
"I guess this beats sitting around waiting for the world to end.",
"So you pulled me out of cryo just in time for the end of the world?",
"I wake up from cryo to find out time travel's a thing and there are monsters everywhere?... yeah, that pretty much tops my list of bad days.",
column16:
"My road has been long, but it has led me where I need to be.",
"I've lost track of the years I spent in fallen timelines, but not the tricks I learned for dealing with the Vek.",
"After so years of surviving in fallen timelines, it seems I have found hope once again.",
"How long was I wandering the wastes before finding the Pod that brought me here? Years? Centuries?",
column17:
"Dr. #self_second, reporting. Honored to be participating in this effort in a more direct capacity.",
"You can only watch the world fall apart through a telescope for so long. I'm ready to help on the front line.",
"I must say, even with all my all my research, the idea of these temporal breaches still confounds me. But I guess I should be thankful, as they may represent our salvation.",
column18:
"The Vek are holding all the cards... but I've got a few tricks to show 'em.",
"Heard we're here to solve this Vek problem. Deal me in.",
"Three of us against untold monsters? I like those odds.",
column19:
"Such a strange future. I still do not understand how I came to be here, but our mandate is clear; to defeat these demons.",
"Whatever strange sorcery brought me to this future, my duty now is to protect its people.",
"I never thought to see such monsters as the ones in this age. However I came to be here, I will see them defeated.",
column20:
"This war is regrettable...but we must focus on the unique opportunities it presents.",
"The Vek represent a uniquely durable strain of test subjects for my experiments.",
"I look forward to getting my hands on some deceased Vek. For science.",
"I trust you are aware of the field experiments I am planning to perform with necrotic Vek tissue?",
column21:
"Not much work for a multi-Corp mercenary if the world comes to an end. So, point me at the Vek.",
"Normally, my skills wouldn't come cheap. But the end of civilization really realigns one's priorities.",
"Feels strange not fighting for a paycheck. But honestly... it's nice to have a noble cause again.",
column22:
"It's time to make things right.",
"Officer #self_second, reporting.",
"I signed up to kill Vek. When do we get to that part?",
column23:
"Inside one of these Mechs, I might just live to see the end of the world. Let's get to it.",
"I don't have any time to waste, and neither does the world. We may both be doomed already...",
"We're all dying... but some faster than others. Let's not waste any time.",
"I don't have all day. Let's get started.",
column24:
"Okay, let's do this!",
"Time to put on my greatest performance yet.",
"All the world's a stage... but we have to save it first.",
"We need to save the world... time to work a little magic!",
column25:
"We can't just continue on as we've been going... if we don't adapt and evolve, everyone is doomed.",
"These Mechs are our best chance against the Vek. I don't know if that makes me feel better, or worse...",
"I look forward to visiting Pinnacle again. I feel Zenith will approve of my augmentations.",
column26:
"Ready to go, commander.",
"These scans show the Vek encroaching at an alarming rate. We have to get the #squad out there and start pushing back.",
column28:
"I'm ready.",
"Time to save the world. This one, at least.",
"If we fail here, we can always try again in another timeline.",

column3: Happens on the island screen after finding the FTL pilot in a pod.
column4: "Do you hear that? Some kind of strange signal coming from that device? Sounds almost like...",
column5: "Hey look, something stranger than the giant bugs."
column6: "What is that? Is it food?",
column7: "Is that some kind of experimental Time Pod?",
column8: "What island does this joker come from?",
column9: "Seen a lot of Time Pods, but never one quite like this...",
column10:
"That's new. What is it?",
"That's not from my timeline.",
column11: "Is this fellow from the future? I can't understand it at all.",
column12: "A strange creature indeed. Is it from this world?",
column13: "I did not think to set eyes on you again...",
column14: "Hmm.",
column15: "What the... anyone want to tell me what this thing is?",
column16:
"It seems I may not be the strangest thing to pilot one of our Mechs, after all.",
"It is comforting to know that I am not the only curiosity in our squad.",
column17:
"I wonder what planet, or timeline, or... place this creature has arrived from?",
"I would love the opportunity to study our new friend, but I suppose that can wait.",
column18: "Huh. At least it's not some weird, blue-skinned demon or something.",
column19:
"Another strange traveler to bolster our forces.",
"This creature's presence here is strange, but then, so is my own.",
column20: "Curious. Warrants further study.",
column21: "Let's face it, this is not the strangest thing we've seen recently.",
column22:
"Glad to have you. You look like you know your way around a fight.",
"So, uh, where you from?",
column23: "What ARE you?",
column24:
"Well, we certainly found a strange customer...",
"That's... not a costume, is it?",
column25:
"I'm no longer a sound judge of what is or is not strange, so... welcome.",
"Hmm. You seem like a useful ally.",
column26:
"I love meeting new people. Welcome aboard.",
"Nice to meet you. Not from around here?",
column28: "Is that some kind of experimental Time Pod?",

column3: Happens after you start a new game with an FTL pilot. Only needed for Recruits
Start of new game after winning
column4:
"Hey guys! Nice to meet you. Let's save this timeline too!",
"Doing this all over again doesn't make it any less scary. Hope my luck holds.",
column5:
"That winning glow fades fast. Time to start all over again... some world always needs saving.",
"So much for my day off. Well, saving one more timeline can't hurt.",
column6:
"Time loop? Again? I guess we need to save this timeline now.",
"What day is it? I'm losing track.",
"Sunshine! I'm back above ground!",
column7:
"We saved the world once. Let's see if we can do it again.",
"These Vek don't know that we've already saved the world. Let's show them again.",
column8:
"Told you we could do it. And we can do it again.",
"I'm getting too old for this. But I guess one more timeline can't hurt.",
column9:
"#self_second, reporting again. I've got some fight left in me, might as well make good of it.",
"There's always more people need saving. No rest for me, then.",
column10:
"Sorry, I'm always a bit scattered after the big jumps. Did I make it to the right point in this timeline? You're at war with the Vek, right? Have I said any of this already?",
"I'm here to help with the Vek problem. And to make sure this timeline ends as well as my last one.",
"I hate those big jumps... #self_second, Mech pilot, here to help save the world. Trust me, it can be done.",
column11:
"Time is a funny thing...we saved the world, but... here, it hasn't happened yet.",
"I wish we could open a breach to Old Earth, before the Vek. I'd love to have seen it...",
"The islands, the Grid... it all looks so similar. But they're unmarked by our battles from the last timeline...",
column12: "There's something sad about starting over... but something hopeful in that we have the chance to succeed again.",
column13:
"The seasons turn, an endless cycle... time travel is not so different.",
"Uprooting these monsters from every timeline will not be easy!",
"New faces! It is nice to meet you.",
column14: "One more deployment won't kill me.",
column15: "Great; win the day and... what's my reward? Doing it all over again.",
column16:
"Greetings again, commander. You don't know me... but I know you.",
"I wonder... am I beyond the ravages of time? Is it my fate to continue this loop for eternity?",
"I feel like some piece of my soul is... lost, with each loop. How many times can you save the world before losing yourself?",
column17:
"I have observed success against the Vek. Now that observation must influence the outcome of this timeline.",
"So strange, to be back at the start of it all. Dr. #self_second, reporting once more to help save the world.",
column18:
"Hope I haven't used up all my luck.",
"Fate's just playing games with me, isn't she? Guess it serves me right.",
"Fate's giving me a second chance.",
column19:
"I cannot return to my own time knowing that such dark futures still exist.",
"Strange to relive one moment in time, over and over. This appears to be the exact moment I originally arrived in this future.",
"Is what lies ahead the same as what lies behind? Apparently Time is a most mysterious thing.",
column20:
"My research will continue in this timeline.",
"I suppose, in a way, time travel is the true science of resurrection.",
"The war may have been won in my previous timeline, but my study of death is far from complete...",
column21:
"If we manage to save this timeline, maybe we can discuss compensation.",
"Can't believe I'm about to do that all over again... but sitting by and doing nothing is harder.",
column22:
"Too many Vek, and not enough bullets.",
"Let's send these Vek to their doom.",
"I feel like a ghost in my own skin, with all this time travel.",
column23:
"Seems time travel has reversed some of the cellular decay from my... condition. Let's not waste time, then.",
"I've got some fire left in me. This timeline will need it.",
"Maybe this timeline actually has a cure for my condition... I suppose it won't matter until we defeat the Vek.",
column24:
"Time for an encore!",
"Time for a repeat performance... let's save the world again!",
"I guess with time travel there's no such thing as a 'limited engagement'. #self_first the Magnificent, reporting again!",
column25:
"I wonder what effect time travel has on my augmentations...",
"We succeeded once before. Time to replicate that success.",
"Everything seems just like it was... except me, I guess.",
column26:
"We can't count on the same tricks working in every timeline.",
"We've found one route to victory... let's hope it holds for this timeline.",
column28:
"We saved the world once. Let's see if we can do it again.",
"These Vek don't know that we've already saved the world. Let's show them again.",

column3: If this unit is dead, but gets repaired
column4:
"Whoa! Thought I was done for.",
"Yeah, #self_mech is back in the fight!",
column5:
"Grr... told you I was hard to kill!",
"I'm not dead yet... but it's still early.",
column6:
"I bounced back!",
"I thought I broke something, but seems okay now.",
column7:
"Takes more than that to keep me out of a fight.",
"My turn.",
"Close call there.",
column8:
"I'm not going down that easy.",
"I didn't live this long by being easy to kill.",
column9:
"Thought I was done for. Guess not.",
"Well, what do you know? I'm not dead.",
"This is #self_second, I'm back in active status!",
"I'm breathing better already.",
column10:
"My thanks to whoever brought me back.",
"Gonna feel that for a few days.",
"Thought they got me. I'll make sure they don't get another chance.",
column11:

column3: What's the plan?
column4: "This hive is enormous... I can hear millions of Vek! What do we do?"

column3:
Damage commentary comes in three flavors:

"SELF" : The Mech did themselves

"OBS" : The Mech (or CEO) observed another Mech do it

"VEK" : A Vek did it, and a CEO or Mech is commenting on that

"Keep the Vek in the ground, #squad!",
column6:
"Gotta block the tunnels so the Vek can't get to the surface!",
"My #self_mech is nice and heavy; it should be able to keep the Vek from popping out of their tunnels.",
column7:
"Much as we all like fighting Vek, we should try to keep them underground...",
"Prevent the Vek from surfacing if you can. We'll kill any that make it through.",
"Block the Vek before they emerge.",
column8:
"We've got orders to block those spawn points. What are you folks waiting for, an invitation?",
"Need to block the Vek tunnels before they see daylight.",
column9:
"If you've got sufficient hull integrity, use your Mech to block their tunnels.",
"Keeping the Vek underground will minimize civilian casualties.",
column10:
"Get your Mechs on top of those emerging Vek, #squad.",
"Block those emergence points before this battle gets any more crowded.",
"Our orders are to keep the Vek underground.",
column11:
"Trust me, things turn out better for us if we keep the Vek underground.",
"We can't let the Vek make it to the surface.",
column12:
"Come on #squad, let's give those emerging Vek more to fight than just gravity.",
"My Grav Anchor can't pin the Vek underground; we'll have to do that manually.",
column13:
"#self_mech, we must stop the Vek from emerging!",
"Even Winter cannot freeze the ground hard enough to stop these Vek from tunneling... so we must do it.",
"Do not allow these monsters to find the sunlight.",
column14:
"Don't let the Vek leave their holes.",
"Stop any more Vek from emerging.",
column15:
"If we block their tunnels we might be able to finish this a lot quicker.",
"I haven't forgotten about blocking the emergence points. I'm just taking my time.",
column16:
"We need to keep the Vek from reaching the surface.",
"Block as many Vek from emerging as possible. Let me greet any that slip through.",
column17:
"If we can prevent any more Vek from surfacing, our job here will be considerably easier...",
"Commander, we'll do our best to prevent any more Vek from emerging.",
column18:
"Our odds of winning improve greatly if we can keep the Vek underground.",
"Better we cut off the Vek reinforcements."
column19:
"We are charged to keep the demons from reaching the surface.",
"Remember our charge: the demons must not escape their tunnels.",
column20:
"I have plenty of Vek corpses to study; prevent any more from surfacing.",
"Block the Vek from surfacing.",
"Do not let more Vek escape the underworld.",
column21:
"Don't forget, team, we need to keep the Vek underground.",
"Keep as many Vek from surfacing as you can; commander's orders.",
column22:
"Keep these vermin underground.",
"We can't afford to let more of these things topside.",
column23:
"Apparently our combat proficiency is in question... We've been order to keep the Vek in the ground, so we don't have to fight them.",
"Keep the Vek buried. Don't let them see the light of day.",
"Seal off those tunnel entrances before the Vek can emerge.",
column24:
"Don't let those Vek out of their tunnels!",
"Block those emerging Vek; we've got enough problems to deal with already.",
column25:
"Get your Mechs on top of the spawn points! We need to make sure those Vek stay underground.",
"Use your seismic sensors to detect emerging Vek, and block those points.",
column26:
"Maneuver the Vek onto the spawn points! If that fails, use your Mechs to block them!",
"If we can't stop those Vek reinforcements from emerging, we're going to get overrun!",
column28:
"Much as we all like fighting Vek, we should try to keep them underground...",
"Prevent the Vek from surfacing if you can. We'll kill any that make it through.",
"Block the Vek before they emerge.",

column4:
"Bombers! Thank goodness, we need all the support we can get.",
"Archive bombers have relayed their targeting telemetry; avoid those areas!",
column5:
"Air support inbound. Don't get in their way.",
"The bombers are bringing the fire... let's roast some Vek with it.",
"Stay clear, I want to watch these Vek try to eat bombs.",
column6:
"I want to get a look at those bombers! But maybe I should stay back...",
"Tell the bombers not to hit us!",
"Everyone be careful of the bombs.",
column7:
"Archive bombers inbound to steal our kills.",
"Air support coming in hot!",
"I'd stay out of the bombers' way, #squad.",
column8:
"I've got a line to the Archive squadron, their bomber is almost here.",
"I'm relaying the bomber's targeting data to your screens, everyone. Stay clear.",
column9:
"Archive bombers, you're clear to engage. The #squad will make sure to stay out of your way.",
"Let's light up some Vek to guide in the bombers.",
column10:
"Inbound airstrike.",
"Bombs incoming. Maybe we can shove some Vek into the blast zone.",
"Archive bomber is on approach!",
column11:
"An Old Earth bomber! My apologies, I got excited. Moving out of the impact zone.",
"Bombers! Glad to see them.",
column12:
"Stay alert, those bombers don't always aim precisely.",
"Air support is inbound. We need to stay out of their firing zones.",
column13:
"The metal birds will be here soon, to drop their fire.",
"The winds bring our allies near... do not get in their way.",
"The Archive has sent flying machines to assist us!",
column14:
"Airstrike. Be alert.",
"Archive bombers inbound.",
column15:
"I'm staying well clear of that airstrike.",
"Bombers. About time.",
column16:
"I forgot how much Archive loves their Old Earth weapons... one of their bombers is inbound.",
"Archive just relayed their bomber's next target.",
column17:
"Satellites show Archive bombers inbound. Brace yourselves.",
"Archive bombers are relaying their targeting data. Stay out of their crosshairs!",
column18:
"I wouldn't bet on surviving one of those airstrikes... best stay clear.",
"Archive bombers don't leave much behind; watch yourselves.",
"Here come the bombers. This should be entertaining.",
column19:
"Our allies appear to have some sort of dragon in their employ, and it approaches.",
"Stay clear of the areas designated for bombardment!",
column20:
"Our angel of death approaches.",
"Hellfire will rain down upon them.",
"Use caution; nothing will survive that bombardment.",
column21:
"Our friends in the sky are bringing the fire; watch your positioning.",
"Archive air support is about to strike; don't get between them and their targets.",
column22:
"Looks like Archive has found these Vek wanting, and bombers are on their way.",
"Can't argue with targeted airstrikes.",
column23:
"Air support is inbound.",
"Archive seems to think we can't handle this on our own. Airstrike incoming.",
"Unless you have a death wish, don't stray near those bombs.",
column24:
"Anything in the target zone is going to disappear in a flash; stay sharp!",
"Those Archive birds are pretty accurate, but I still wouldn't stand too close.",
column25:
"One of those old Archive bombers is about to hit this sector.",
"Archive still has working Old Earth planes, and one's on its way to bomb these Vek.",
column26:
"Here come the bombers.",
"I don't think our Mechs will withstand those bombs; stay clear of the target coordinates!",
"Nobody get blown up!",
column28:
"Archive bombers inbound to steal our kills.",
"Air support coming in hot!",
"I'd stay out of the bombers' way, #squad.",

column3: Both tanks survived to activation
column4:
"Yes! Let's welcome our newest allies, #squad.",
"They may be ancient, but those tanks should be useful against the Vek.",
"The more the merrier!",
column5:
"Those old cannons are ready for action.",
"Those tanks don't look like much, but we'll make good use of their support.",
"Alright, #squad, we've got tank support.",

"Look, those little tanks are working now!",
"The tanks are helping us!",
"Both tanks are working; nobody step on one by accident. Or on purpose.",
"Tanks!",
column7:
"Welcome to the party.",
"Tanks are online.",
"These old tanks look ready for action.",
column8:
"Strength in numbers.",
"You can never have too many allies. Let's put these tanks to work.",
"We'll take all the help we can get, even Old Earth hardware.",
"Those tanks are older than me, and almost as formidable.",

column3: Remind player to destroy the Dam
column4:
"Can anyone spare some firepower for that dam? Guys?",
"Such a pretty valley... but I guess it's more important to block the Vek with that water."
column5:
"Anyone not tangling with the Vek, go for that dam.",
"Anyone have a clear shot at the dam?",
"That's a lot of water... they really want us to flood this place?",
column6:
"Remember we're supposed to break the dam. Can I do it?",
"I like breaking things on purpose! Let's get that dam.",
"Breaking that dam will help flood the Vek's tunnels.",
column7:
"Someone needs to take out that dam. Should we draw straws?",
"I'm kinda busy here... anyone else able to bring down that dam?",
"If we can destroy that dam we may be able to drown a whole mess of them at once...",
column8:
"The dam is still standing. Let's rectify that.",
"Our job here's not done until that dam comes down.",
"We're running low on time. Need to blow that dam.",
column9:
"Who wants to volunteer for demolition duty? The rest of us will hold off the Vek.",
"We can't secure this area while that dam is intact.",
column10:
"Remember, that dam needs to come down.",
"We'll need to take out the dam to fully secure this area.",
"The city still needs its new river.",
column11:
"Bringing down that dam should give us a tactical advantage.",
"So much water covering the planet... are we really supposed to flood this area?",
column12:
"If we put enough cracks in that dam, water and gravity will do the rest...",
"If we don't bring down that dam, the Vek will keep advancing.",
column13:
"Those waters do not wish to be pent up behind stone... we must unleash them!",
"We must destroy that dam and return water to this valley.",
column14:
"Need to blow that dam.",
"That dam needs to go.",
column15:
"We've still got orders to take out that dam.",
"Who wants to blow up that dam?",
column16:
"We cannot neglect that dam. Until we destroy it, the Vek can advance into this region unhindered.",
"Water was a precious resource in the wasteland. Seems a shame to destroy that dam, but I suppose we have to.",
column17:
"Satellite topography indicates destroying the dam here will create an ideal water barrier against the Vek.",
"Local topography should funnel the water from that dam into the battlefield, if we can breach it.",
column18:
"Let us wash away these Vek, and their sins.",
"That dam is destined for destruction.",
column19:
"We cannot shirk our charge; we must sunder that dam and release its waters.",
"We must breach that dam, so that its waters might protect this settlement.",
column20:
"We must destroy that dam if we are to secure this region.",
"The quickest way to make corpses of these Vek is to unleash the water from that dam.",
column21:
"Don't forget, team, we need to blow that dam to secure this area.",
"We still need to destroy that dam; commander's orders.",
column22:
"We've been tasked with demolishing that dam. Who wants to take the first swing?",
"#squad, someone get their weapons armed and take a shot at the dam.",
column23:
"We've been ordered to bring down this dam. Let's see if it was built to code...",
"We need to destroy that dam. Fortunately, property damage is a specialty of mine.",
"Get me near that dam and I'll have it down in no time.",
column24:
"These Vek look thirsty; let's get them some water.",
"These Vek look like they could use a few thousands gallons of water. Hey look, a dam.",
column25:
"Time to rearrange the water table in this sector. Blowing that dam should keep out the Vek.",
"We need to put some cracks in that dam; water pressure should do the rest.",
column26:
"We need to put some cracks in that dam. Eventually, the water pressure will take over and finish the job.",
"We need to break that dam.",
column28:
"Someone needs to take out that dam. Should we draw straws?",
"I'm kinda busy here... anyone else able to bring down that dam?",
"If we can destroy that dam we may be able to drown a whole mess of them at once...",

column3: After the completed animation of the dam drowning things
column4:
"That's... almost scenic, all that water.",
"Dam collapse is confirmed. Hope it works.",
column5:
"Should have brought my water wings.",
"Now Archive can charge extra for the pool access.",
"Come on in, the water's great!",
column6:
"Boom, no more dam.",
"I hope #corp is happy that we broke it!",
"That was exciting!",
column7:
"Now let's push some Vek into the water.",
"Well done, squad. Let's use that river as a weapon.",
column8:
"Now I can get my toes wet.",
"Let's give these Vek a bath.",
"That river is a weapon. Use it.",
column9:
"A new kind of trench warfare.",
"This is #self_second, confirming destruction of the dam.",
"Well, that was satisfying.",
column10:
"Here comes the river...",
"Don't get washed away, #squad.",
"Objective complete. Now let's deal with the Vek.",
column11:
"Permission to go for a swim? Forgive me, I suppose it's not the time.",
"A river to guard our cities!",
column12:
"They're going to have to redraw their maps.",
"One river, made to order.",
column13:
"Let the Vek die in the water, and the earth thrive in it.",
"We did it!",
column14:
"That's better.",
"Back to focusing on the Vek.",
column15:
"Great, more water. Not like we're already on an island...",
"Let's send the Vek to their pool date now.",
column16:
"What a pleasant river we have created.",
"The river has resumed its natural course.",
column17: "Our topographical analysis appears to have been accurate. This river should aid in defeating the local Vek.",
column18:
"That should thwart the creatures' advance.",

column19:
"Let the river wash these demons from the Earth.",
"That was well done.",
column20:
"Excellent.",

column21:
"Don't anybody get washed away.",

"Good thing our Mechs can survive getting a little wet.",
column22:
"Now let's introduce these Vek to Charon.",

column23:

"Purposeful destruction is so much more satisfying.",
column24:
"Time for swimming lessons!",
"Now let's see how well these Vek swim!",
"That should keep this city a little safer.",
column25:

"Excellent. We'll have to redraw the maps of this sector, but the Vek will have a harder time invading.",

column28:
"Now let's push some Vek into the water.",

"It seems death is closer than usual today.",
"With our Mechs in this condition, the situation is dire. Seek out immediate field repairs!",
column21:
"My #self_mech needs a bit more repair work than I feel comfortable doing myself.",
"What were the mechanics even doing between missions?",
column22:
"I'm going to have some harsh words with the maintenance crew after this.",
"If we survive this, I'm overseeing all future repairs in person.",
column23:
Great, reactor's already failing. Those repair technicians must have a death wish."",
"Everyone stay clear until I get my reactor patched up.",
column24:
"A little extra dramatic tension! This should be quite a show.",
"Don't worry #squad, I'm good at avoiding death!",
column25:
"My #self_mech can't sustain further damage. Prioritizing field repairs.",
"Those Repair Platforms should be able to get us back in fighting shape.",
column26:
"Better find our way to those Repair Platforms, with haste.",
"I've mapped out nearby Repair Platforms. Get to them before the Vek do.",
column28:
"Well this is a fine mess.",
"Nothing like a little extra challenge.",

column4:
"Sounds like we have a new ally!",
"I wish we could solve all our computer problems that way.",
column5:
"Look who's friendly all of a sudden.",
"#ceo_second, we fixed your robot.",
column6:
"We broke something and it fixed something else!",
"That robot still looks angry, but not at us anymore.",
column7:
"About time that hunk of metal came to its senses.",
"There, fixed the problem.",
column8:
"There, now someone explain how the Vek hacked that bot to begin with. That's my bigger concern.",
"No one hold a grudge; it's on our side now, and we need all the help we can get.",
column9:
"That corrupted signal seems to have been purged.",
"That should have our robot friend feeling better.",
column10:
"I'm not detecting any further hostile transmissions.",
"Task that bot with some new orders.",
column11:
"That should turn the tides!",
"That bot is back on our team!",
column12:
"Corrupted signal has been terminated.",
"Now, turn those cannons against the Vek.",
column13:
"The corruption has been washed away.",
"Our friend is returned to us!",
column14:
"Bot has been reset.",
"That should stop it from trying to kill us.",
column15:
"Are we really going to start trusting that bot all of a sudden?",
"Time to earn your keep, you piece of traitorous metal.",
column16:
"Be free of corruption.",
"A new ally! About time.",
column17:
"I'm picking up friendly readings from that asset now.",
"Looks like that rebooted our friend.",
column18:
"You've been given a second chance, little friend. Don't waste it.",
"Now, don't forget whose side you're on.",
column19:
"That automaton has come to its senses.",
"The spell has been lifted.",
column20:
"Would that I could dissect this robot and learn how the Vek interfaced with it.",
"Our fickle friend has swapped its allegiance once more.",
column21:
"Taking out that Station got us a new ally.",
"That cannon doesn't look as scary when it's pointed at the Vek.",
column22:
"Alright, little robot, take some revenge on these Vek.",
"However the Vek managed to hack it, that bot is going to make them pay now!",
column23:
"Maybe now you can make up for all the havoc you've wrought.",
"If that robot goes rogue again, just end it.",
column24:
"Looks like the Vek hypnosis has worn off!",
"That should stop the Vek from controlling our robot.",
column25:
"Uplink reestablished. Restasking combat robot for fire support.",
"That bot is registering as a friendly again.",
column26:
"Finally, one of #ceo_second's bots that isn't trying to kill us.",
"The reprogramming appears to be a success.",
column28:
"About time that hunk of metal came to its senses.",
"There, fixed the problem.",

column4:
"Time to be extra careful.",
"Shield Generator is offline!",
column5:
"Don't get cozy, all shields are off.",
"Time to him 'em where it hurts.",
column6:
"Time to hit stuff.",
"The Vek are unprotected! But so are the buildings.",
column7:
"#corp shouldn't miss that piece of junk.",
"Hope no one was using those shields.",
column8:
"Careful now, we're in the open along with the enemy.",
"Rely on your training, #squad, not the shields.",
column9:
"So much for defense. Now we go with offense.",
"Shield Generator is offline, and our shields went with it.",
column10:
"Their shields are down! Time to engage!",
"Hope everyone was ready for that.",
column11:
"Well, that leveled the playing field, I guess.",
"Our shields are down! But so are the enemy's.",
column12:
"Proceed with caution, and without shields.",
"Should be easier to engage the Vek... but also more dangerous.",
column13:
"... like stars going out.",
"All things must end.",
column14:
"Shields down. The Vek are vulnerable.",
"Press the attack.",
column15:
"Wasn't using that shield anyway.",
"Bet the Vek weren't expecting that.",
column16:
"Exercise caution, and press the attack.",
"All local shields appear to have gone offline.",
column17:
"Shields in this whole sector just went dark when the Generator failed.",
"All shields are down!",
column18:
"We've all met the same fate.",
"We're all exposed now.",
column19:
"Back to relying on our armor.",
"The enemy defenses are down. Strike!",
column20:
"The Vek are now vulnerable!",
"A device that aids the enemy is not worth keeping.",
column21:
"Line up your shots, everyone! They're exposed!",
"Now that those shields are out of the way: open fire!",
column22:
"I see an opening.",
"Time to go on the offensive!",
column23:
"That's what I've been waiting for! No more shielded Vek.",
"No more shields to slow us down!",
column24:
"All the shields just disappeared!",
"Was that supposed to happen? All shields are down.",
column25:
"That pulse knocked out all local energy shielding.",
"All shields offline.",
column26:
"Careful, we're not shielded any more.",
"We've lost our shields, but so have the Vek.",
column28:
"#corp shouldn't miss that piece of junk.",
"Hope no one was using those shields.",

column4: "There's so much noise.. I've never heard so many approaching Vek.",
column5: "Hold fast, everyone. This swarm won't break us.",
column6: "Incoming!",
column7: "Here they come.",
column8: "Massive swarm detected. Looks like there will be plenty of Vek to go around.",
column9: "Get yourselves ready, this won't be no picnic.",
column10: "No escape, no retreat. Here they come.",
column11: "Stand your ground, #squad! Here comes the swarm!",
column12: "I wonder what could draw such a massive swarm to this location.",
column13: "The storm is upon us.",
column14: "Get ready.",
column15: "Who ordered a massive swarm of Vek?",
column16: "The ground seethes with approaching Vek.",
column17: "I'm reading massive seismic activity; the Vek swarm is right beneath us.",
column18: "The hour is at hand.",
column19: "The enemy is upon us, in greater strength than ever.",
column20: "I have never detected so many Vek at once...",
column21: "Can't track all these incoming targets We're in for a rough time.",
column22: "The Vek are trying to overwhelm us. Stand your ground.",
column23: "Here they come. Drawn to the flame.",
column24: "This doesn't look good. I'm reading, uh, quite a lot of underground Vek.",
column25: "Swarm approaching. This whole area is infested!",
column26: "Get ready, here they come.",
column28: "Here they come.",

column4: "Avoid any exposure to that Vek!",
column5: "My Titan Armor won't help against the plague that thing's carrying. Better stay back waaay back.",
column6: "That thing is full of death!",
column7: "Let's take out this walking plague before it infects and kills us all.",
column8: "Engage that monster at range. Don't risk getting infected; you won't survive.",
column9: "Whatever this thing is carrying, we don't have a cure, so keep your Mechs away. Don't worry about the buildings, they're hermetically sealed.",
column10: "Better vacate the premises and strike that thing from a distance; don't want to hang around and catch its cold.",
column11: "Better get clear, that infection is deadly!",
column12: "I can't risk getting close enough to use my Grav Anchor on that Vek.",
column13: "This demon spreads its evil to all living things. We must end its suffering.",
column14: "A grim herald. If we don't stop this Vek, eventually the plague will make its way into these structures.",
column15: "Better put that thing on ice, before it takes us all out.",
column16: "The wastelands were full of such rotten horrors; strange, and unwelcome, to see one in this timeline.",
column17: "Perhaps we can turn this monstrosity to our advantage; its allies are as susceptible to its plague as we are.",
column18: "Don't dance with this devil; it won't end well.",
column19: "This plague bearer must be dispatched quickly, or we will all be laid low.",
column20: "Fascinating. This specimen is seemingly immune to the deadly pathogen it spreads. Unfortunately we are not.",
column21: "Take out that Vek before it infects us; our Mechs aren't build for biological warfare.",
column22: "Kill that Vek and burn the body. Otherwise we're all done for.",
column23: "A kindred spirit, one whose touch burns friend and foe alike.",
column24: "I might survive that plague, but I'd rather not chance it. Let's engage from a distance.",
column25: "Lethality of that pathogen is high. Buildings should be safe, but our Mechs aren't sealed as well.",
column26: "Let's kill that thing first, and we can figure out where it came from later. And do it carefully!",
column28: "Let's take out this walking plague before it infects and kills us all.",
